history.content:
Yes, CS 194s would count. Technical classes = CS, EE, EECS, other Engineering, Math, and Science classes. 

For your last semester, you can schedule an appointment or email your ESS advisor and ask for a reduced course load.

For the College of Engineering's requirement of enrolling in a minimum of 2 technical courses per semester to stay enrolled (http://engineering.berkeley.edu/2016-17-undergraduate-guide/2016-17-procedures-and-regulations under "Course Load"), would a letter-graded CS 194 class count towards this enrollment requirement?

Also, is there an exception to this requirement for senior year (especially if one already has satisfied all technical/engineering units to graduate the major)? The example EECS schedule (at http://engineering.berkeley.edu/undergraduate-guide/degree-requirements/eecs) seems to show only 3 engineering units taken during second semester of senior year.
history.subject: 2 Technical Classes Per Semester Requirement
